alert.note: Alert for Adams; Jackson; Juneau; Monroe (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 12 at 6:49AM CDT until March 12 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Slick Roads As Snow Continues... .Precipitation will continue for much of the day with visibilities reduced to under a mile at times and snow rates exceeding 1/2 inch per hour. Light freezing drizzle may also be possible as heavier snowfall exits east this morning. Additional accumulations are expected this evening, across north-central Wisconsin, with moderate confidence in exact location of a heavier snow band. Given the higher amounts clipping Taylor County, have upgraded to warning for the remaining headline period. Increased snowfall amounts and rates may just graze northeastern edges of Clark County as well. Slow down and use extra caution if driving today and tonight. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...Jackson, Monroe, Juneau and Adams Counties. * WHEN...Until 1 PM CDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
